channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [HBASE-15228] Add the methods to RegionObserver to trigger start/complete restoring WALs
item.description: In our use case, we write indexes to a index table when restoring WALs. We want to trigger start/complete restoring WALs for initial and end processing for writing indexes.
item.summary: Add the methods to RegionObserver to trigger start/complete restoring WALs

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

comments.comment: I attached the patch. I added preRestoreWALs and postRestoreWALs to RegionObserver.

lgtm overall


688	        // put two times

689	        table.put(put);

Why is the above needed ?
When we put two times, preRestoreWALs and postRestoreWALs should be called once, but preWALRestore and postWALRestore should be called more than once. I wrote test code verifying that.
We have some CP hooks around restore WAL already right?
Yes, we have preWALRestore and postWALRestore in RegionObserver already. But those are called per WAL. The methods I added are called when start/complete restoring WALs.
Please let me know if the patch has a problem or you have any questions about the patch.

Understood the need.. The existing hooks are called pre/post each WAL entry. The new method names looks confusing with the existing ones
preWALRestore vs preRestoreWALs.. Any suggestions Ted Yu
One option is to name the new methods preReplayWALs() and postReplayWALs() since they're called inside replayRecoveredEdits().

Thank you Anoop Sam John Ted Yu.

The suggestion renaming the methods is a good idea. I attached new patch with renaming the methods.

Could you please check my new patch?

-1 overall

This message was automatically generated.
Is there any problem in my patch?
Would you mind rebasing Toshihiro Suzuki? It no longer applies. Lets get another run in. Otherwise +1 on patch.

Normally the pre hooks honor bypass. See preWALRestore() and its usage. Do we want to do same with new pre hook also?
Also do we need to pass WAL detail also to hooks? I see WAL reader is private and not exposed.

Thank you stack.
I rebased the patch and attached new patch as HBASE-15228-v2.patch.

Thank you Anoop Sam John.

> Normally the pre hooks honor bypass. See preWALRestore() and its usage. Do we want to do same with new pre hook also?
I didn't make it possible to bypass WAL replay because I couldn't think of usecase bypassing WAL replay.
If we want to bypass WAL replay, we can put with SKIP_WAL.

> Also do we need to pass WAL detail also to hooks? I see WAL reader is private and not exposed.
To pass WAL detail to the hooks is a good idea, but I have no idea what we should pass, except WAL.Reader.
What do you think about that?

Agree. The bypass do not make much sense.. Make sure to add that in javadoc of RegionObserver method. That calling bypass is not making any impact. Some other pre hook also discarding bypass.. Just say in doc.

Ya I could also see like the reader available but that is internal and might not worth passing it. May be just pass the path? Just for the CP impl to know which WAL it is dealing with now.

FAILURE: Integrated in HBase-Trunk_matrix #938 (See https://builds.apache.org/job/HBase-Trunk_matrix/938/)
HBASE-15228 Add the methods to RegionObserver to trigger start/complete (anoopsamjohn: rev 0e52ac2464afe049b14930eeb3e879698743f27e)

  • hbase-server/src/test/java/org/apache/hadoop/hbase/coprocessor/TestRegionObserverInterface.java
  • hbase-server/src/main/java/org/apache/hadoop/hbase/regionserver/HRegion.java
  • hbase-server/src/main/java/org/apache/hadoop/hbase/coprocessor/RegionObserver.java
  • hbase-server/src/main/java/org/apache/hadoop/hbase/coprocessor/BaseRegionObserver.java
  • hbase-server/src/test/java/org/apache/hadoop/hbase/coprocessor/SimpleRegionObserver.java
  • hbase-server/src/main/java/org/apache/hadoop/hbase/regionserver/RegionCoprocessorHost.java

customfieldvalues.customfieldvalue:
Added two hooks around WAL restore.
preReplayWALs(final ObserverContext<? extends RegionCoprocessorEnvironment> ctx, HRegionInfo info, Path edits)
and
postReplayWALs(final ObserverContext<? extends RegionCoprocessorEnvironment> ctx, HRegionInfo info, Path edits)

Will be called at start and end of restore of a WAL file.
The other hook around WAL restore (preWALRestore ) will be called before restore of every entry within the WAL file.
